definitions: in a way that relates to ancient Greek or Latin literature, art, or culture

examples.text: the classically austere traditions of the Roman republic

shortDefinitions: in way that relates to ancient Greek or Latin literature or culture

definitions: (with reference to art or architecture) in a way that resembles or is influenced by ancient Greek or Roman forms or principles

examples.text: fine architecture and beautiful, classically designed buildings

shortDefinitions: (of art or architecture) in way that resembles or is influenced by ancient Greek or Roman forms or principles

definitions: to an exemplary standard within a traditional and long-established form or style

examples.text: a classically trained British stage actor
a truly terrific evening of classically inspired dance

shortDefinitions: to exemplary standard within traditional and long-established form or style

definitions: in a way that relates to the first significant period of an area of study

examples.text: so much of Marxist economics was classically oriented
Iberian horses have been classically divided into two native groups

shortDefinitions: in way that relates to first significant period of area of study

definitions: in a way that is very typical of its kind
shortDefinitions: in way that is very typical of its kind

definitions: according to or in accordance with concepts and theories which preceded the theories of relativity and quantum mechanics

examples.text: we can describe light classically in terms of an electromagnetic wave
wormholes may be unstable, both classically or quantum mechanically

shortDefinitions: according to or in accordance with concepts and theories which preceded the theories of relativity and quantum mechanics
